Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Singer \Sin"ger\ (s[i^]n"j[~e]r), n. [From {Singe}.] One who, or that which, singes. Specifically: (a) One employed to singe cloth. (b) A machine for singeing cloth. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Singer \Sing"er\, n. [From {Sing}.] One who sings; especially, one whose profession is to sing. [1913 Webster]

singer n 1: a person who sings [syn: {vocalist}, {vocalizer}, {vocaliser}] 2: United States inventor of an improved chain-stitch sewing machine (1811-1875) [syn: {Isaac M. Singer}, {Isaac Merrit Singer}] 3: United States writer (born in Poland) of Yiddish stories and novels (1904-1991) [syn: {Isaac Bashevis Singer}]
